title: Geometric yet Friendly Sans-Serif
content:
Hey everyone,

I'm tweaking a logo for a church and looking for the perfect sans-serif. Ideally it would be something pretty geometric -- I'm looking for a round "O" to complement the mark. Also, I would prefer something with a single-story lowercase "a." Right now I'm actually considering using Futura. It's definitely geometric, but it doesn't come off as very warm or personable.

Thanks for your help!  
Matt
author: Maverick18x

comments.content:
What application are you using to create the logo? Something that supports the various sorts of OpenType alternates, like Illustrator, InDesign or QuarkXPress 7+?

T

Thomas,

Thanks for the reply. I'm designing in Illustrator. I'd still love to hear your suggestions, but I think might have solved my own dilemma with Avenir. I decided that single-story "a" in Futura was actually hurting the friendlieness-factor. :)

Matt

I almost feel like I'm letting you guys down… our team just came together behind Avenir today. I really appreciate the input, though!
